intro: Neonauclea cyrtopoda, commonly known as the small-leafed neonauclea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Neonauclea cyrtopoda is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
